thread.title: Michael Floyd to critics upset he gets Super Bowl ring: 'Oh well. I'm a champion!'
thread.title_full: Michael Floyd to critics upset he gets Super Bowl ring: 'Oh well. I'm a champion!'

author: Joe Rodgers (joseph.rodgers@peformgroup.com)
title: Michael Floyd to critics upset he gets Super Bowl ring: 'Oh well. I'm a champion!'
text:
NFL February 7, 2017 6:43pm   6:43pm EST American Football, News, English, Michael Floyd, NFL, Arizona Cardinals, Atlanta Falcons, New England Patriots Patriots receiver Michael Floyd didn't play in the Super Bowl or the AFC championship game, but he still will receive a championship ring. Michael Floyd (Getty Images) 
Updated at 6:43 p.m. ET 
Updated at 6:43 p.m. ET 
Patriots receiver Michael Floyd didn't play in the Super Bowl or the AFC championship game, but he still will get a championship ring because he did play three games for New England when the Cardinals cut him following a DUI arrest. Sound unfair? 
Floyd received plenty of criticism on Twitter after posting a picture of himself kissing the Lombardi Trophy Sunday after the Patriots incredible comeback over the Falcons.
